intro: Andira amazonum, commonly known as the Amazonian andira, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant's adaptability to humid, shaded environments makes it a common component of the understory in Amazonian forests.
